Articles.Content:
Atmospheric pressure at Eve Sea Level: 73.47974700196106 pounds per square inch (PSI)

Max temperature on Eve: 302 F

Min temperature on Eve: -40.36 F

With this information at hand, would you survive on Eve for at least 30 seconds?

I already posted something like this, but unpopularity dragged it far behind.

So, could you survive on Eve for a while (30 seconds)???

Oh sure. You'll probably be okay for a few minutes even. There's an atmosphere so you'll be able to hold your breath and the temperatures aren't too extreme. Saunas often get above the boiling point of water and humans bake in those for fun. Of course the atmospheric density is a lot higher so you'll exceed your heat tolerance pretty quickly. But you'll pass out from oxygen deprivation first.

So if you have a quick airlock and you really need to take a leak...

According to the KSP wiki, Eve's atmo composition is:

62.17% CO2, 36.54% nitrogen, and 1.03% argon.
